summary: With a continuous focus on enhancing my skills, I have developed expertise in Windchill PLM and possess a track record of creating innovative code and processes. Holding a Master's degree in computer application and having accumulated a total of 16 years of experience, my primary role involved collaborating with software developers, system engineers, and other IT professionals to oversee the PLM project for the largest medical device company in the Netherlands. I actively participated in all stages of the product lifecycle, ranging from strategic planning to deployment and maintenance. Furthermore, I took charge of implementing end-to-end automation solutions for various business functions, encompassing build, configuration, and development tasks.

projects.title: Philips
projects.description:
Philips, a Dutch diversified technology company headquartered in Amsterdam, operates primarily in the fields of Healthcare, Consumer Lifestyle, and Lighting. Founded by Gerard Philips and his father Frederik in 1891 in Eindhoven, it has grown to become one of the world's largest electronics companies, employing over 122,000 people in more than 60 countries.

Role:
As a Windchill DevOps Architect, my responsibilities encompass various areas such as Cloud Automation, Build Automation, Migration Automation Customization, Configuration, Requirements Analysis, and Estimation.

Responsibilities:

• Develop Artificial Intelligence solutions for cloud server monitoring.
• Establish and manage development process standards for automation and tools.
• Implement end-to-end automation for Windchill development, deployment, configuration, and installation.
• Mentor team members on software development best practices, including automated build and test processes, and CI/CD for programs.
• Create policies, standards, guidelines, governance, and related guidance for CI/CD operations and developers' work.
• Collaborate with the DevOps team to develop and support selected tools, while overseeing suppliers working on other tool development.
• Provide leadership and work collaboratively within the DevOps Group to define policies and proactively address operational issues.
• Actively drive continuous improvement in areas such as quality, risk, compliance, and costs.
• Collaborate with architecture, application development, and infrastructure and operations teams to contribute to the development of the ecommerce ecosystem roadmap.
• Lead the implementation of cloud automation, management, and monitoring systems.
• Assist in software architecture design and deployment methodologies within the Philips C&CN landscape.
• Automate Windchill installations.
• Implement automatic deployment using the Build and Deploy framework (BIF).

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect || PTC Windchill  || PLM  || Azur DevOps || Jenkins || Amazon Cloud - AWS || Automation & AI  || Java || ConfigIT  || ReactJS || Spring Boot

projects.title: Schindler Elevator Ltd
projects.description:
Project Summary:
The Schindler Group, established in Switzerland in 1874, is a global manufacturer of elevators and escalators. They specialize in the production, installation, maintenance, and modernization of these transportation systems in various types of buildings, including residential, commercial, and high-rise structures. This is my second tenure with Schindler, previously working on their Windchill 9.1 PDMProjectLink requirements. Currently, I am involved in the Windchill 10.1 upgrade project and worked on updating Windchill 9.1 M060 to Windchill 9.1 M070.

Role:
As a Lead, my responsibilities encompass customization, configuration, requirements analysis, and estimation.

Responsibilities:
• Upgraded Windchill 9.1 M060 to Windchill M070 due to the dependency on PTC Creo 2.0.
• Customized the entire Project Link to align with Windchill 9.1 in Windchill 10.1.
• Developed MVC component builders for project link and Pdm link for the new Windchill 10.1 MVC view.
• Created custom data utilities for various attributes.
• Adapted the complete PDM Link to match Windchill 9.1 in Windchill 10.1.
• Designed and implemented all custom task form templates to support both old and new workflows.
• Restructured all Schindler Code in SVN, segregating the code based on modules.
• Reconfigured workflows according to the new workflow requirements.
• Integrated with PTC Creo 2 for document publishing.
• Integrated with PTC Arbortext for library publishing (including web services for SAP integration).
• Created new layouts for objects such as soft documents, parts, change requests, projects, and new libraries.
• Customized the Auto Association process to meet specific requirements (as the old reports were not compatible with Windchill 10).
• Developed a new Multi-Level Bill of Material (BOM) report (as the old report was not compatible with Windchill 10).
• Implemented a new Ant Build script for streamlined deployment.
• Ensured complete documentation of each task.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect || PTC Windchill  || PLM  || Azur DevOps || Jenkins || Amazon Cloud - AWS || Automation & AI  || Java || ConfigIT  || ReactJS || Spring Boot

projects.title: TAFE - Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited
projects.description:
Project Summary:

Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited (TAFE), an Indian manufacturer of tractors and farm equipment, has its corporate headquarters in Chennai. Established in 1961, the company achieves an annual revenue of $1.6 billion and sells over 148,000 tractors each year.

Role: Deputation
As a Windchill consultant, my responsibility was to handle critical tasks that were not being addressed by the client and client partner.

Responsibilities:

• Reassignment Utility: Assigning new users to all running processes in the container and team. Developed a standalone multithreaded pool program capable of handling 30,000 processes for the user.
• Custom Picker (Generic): Created a custom picker for handling custom soft part types.
• Implemented a new process to track all old objects attached to the master part.
• Created a PDF report for the primary document of the project. The PDF is automatically attached as an attachment when the document is released.
• Automated the creation of custom Problem Reports based on user selection.
• Developed a notification scheduler for tracking project status changes.
• Completed approximately 30 small but complex tasks within a three-month timeframe.
• Prepared an upgrade proposal for transitioning from Windchill 9.1 to Windchill 10.1.

projects.title: Boston Scientific (BSC) USA
projects.description:
Project Summary:
Boston Scientific (BSC) adopted Parametric Technology Corporation's (PTC) Windchill Foundation 8.0 and 9.1 as the global application for Product Lifecycle Management/Product Data Management (PDM) in 2001 (updated to Windchill 9.1 in 2008). PDM is extensively used across the entire BSC organization and is available globally. The system caters to various functional users, including:

• R&D engineers
• Engineering/Documentation services
• Quality Assurance
• Regulatory Affairs
• Manufacturing Engineering
• Clinical Affairs
• Training
• Manufacturing/Operations
• Finance
• Planning

Role:
As the Lead of the BSC PDM application, my responsibilities encompass customization, configuration, and requirements analysis.

projects.title: Indian Railway IRCTC
projects.description:
Project Summary:
The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) is a subsidiary of the Indian Railways responsible for catering, tourism, and online ticketing operations. It has significantly transformed railway ticketing in India by pioneering internet-based ticket booking through its website and mobile platforms. It also facilitates ticket cancellations or modifications online. Additionally, IRCTC offers I-tickets, which are booked online and delivered by post, alongside E-tickets. The website provides access to the Tickets PNR Status feature, and Mumbai's suburban railway commuters can book season tickets through IRCTC's platform. The Rolling Deposit Scheme (RDS) allows passengers to reserve seats against advance payment, while Ticket Deposit Receipts can be filed online for claiming refunds in case of canceled journeys. The Tatkal Scheme, available for various classes on most Mail/Express trains, enables last-minute bookings starting at 10:00 hrs one day prior to the train's departure from the source station.

Role:
As a Developer, my responsibilities involve customization, requirements analysis, and development tasks within the IRCTC system.

contributors.headline: Senior Solution Architect || PTC Windchill  || PLM  || Azur DevOps || Jenkins || Amazon Cloud - AWS || Automation & AI  || Java || ConfigIT  || ReactJS || Spring Boot

projects.title: Vodafone Italy
projects.description:
Project Summary:
I worked on a significant module within the Vodafone site, specifically in the 190 CIS and 190OLS modules. The 190 CIS module, part of the 190 Systems, focused on managing customers' authentication, web interface personalization, portal management, and content management. It offered services such as registration, portal authentication, single sign-on, personalization, and content management, providing a personalized web experience within the Vodafone portal. The Broad Vision (BV) middleware played a crucial role in managing general presentation, presentation caching, personalization, authentication, and authorization for various areas. Content management functionalities were handled by Interwoven Teamsite.

The CIS module utilized an N-Tier architecture, with the presentation and business layers deployed on the WebLogic server. The Struts framework managed the presentation layer, overseen by BV Portal Admin. Two databases were employed: "OL190" for legacy user-profile data and "BV190" for content. Content creation was performed using Team Site, which published content in XML format to the BV190 database and reflected it simultaneously in Apache. An Apache web server was situated in front of the WebLogic server.

The OLS application facilitated shopping and order processing through the Vodafone website. It encompassed multiple applications for shopping, order processing, call center support, WiFi request order collection, campaign management, and WAP.

Role:
As a Developer, my responsibilities included customization, requirements analysis, and development tasks within the 190 CIS and 190OLS modules.

projects.title: WAL-MART STORES INC.
projects.description:
Project Summary:
The PLM capability project at Wal-Mart, the world's largest retail company, focuses on utilizing FlexPLM for product development. FlexPLM is a configurable solution that aids in product configuration for the organization, particularly for planning seasonal apparel and footwear products. Unlike other enterprise systems used by Wal-Mart, FlexPLM is unique as it centers around products rather than transactions. It seamlessly integrates with the existing enterprise transaction infrastructure. Within Wal-Mart, FlexPLM is primarily utilized in the Home and Apparel divisions.

The Walmart Apparel Project specifically leverages the highly scalable and fully configurable FlexPLM tool. This web-based PLM solution is well-suited for retail, footwear, apparel, and consumer products. Within the PLM environment, various functions are supported, including Calendar Management and New Product Introduction, line planning, color management, sample management, specification management, early sourcing, material and supplier management, costing, and quality management. FlexPLM enables easy searchability of product information based on configurable data rules.

The predominant functional users of the system include management users, domestic vendors, and international vendors.

Role:
As a Senior Software Developer, my responsibilities encompass customization, configuration, and requirements analysis within the Wal-Mart PLM project utilizing FlexPLM.
